--- layout: component title: Carousel description: A carousel is a hero panel used to feature navigational links, typically in the form of eye-catching photos or graphics. A Carousel differs from a Billboard in that it can have multiple presentations that automatically rotate every ~4 seconds (depending on amount of content to visually comprehend) and also have paging controls that allow the user to manually advance or return to the previous; Billboards contain a single presentation. guidelines: do: - Use a carousel when you need to draw the user's attention to featured content - Use a carousel when there are at least two separate content blocks to display - Provide a call to action and link to another page, screen, or UI - Ensure carousel is visually appealing dont: - Use a carousel when you have more than four content blocks to display - Link content to direct downloads or a command that is not part of the navigation - Use carousel on lower level pages (in most cases) contents: - Usage guidelines - Basic Carousel - Light Carousel - Dark Carousel ---
